data.title: Amir Johnson headlines veteran additions for G League Ignite
data.meta_description: Trending News & Rumors for Football, Basketball, Baseball, Hockey, Soccer & More
data.text:
Amir Johnson is among six veteran players who will suit up for the G League Ignite this season, the developmental team announced Thursday.

Johnson played in 15 games for the Ignite during their inaugural 2020-21 campaign, averaging 8.5 points and 3.3 rebounds in 13.3 minutes. He played 14 years in the Association across four different teams.

Former Georgetown center Jesse Govan is also re-joining the Ignite for a second stint.

Dakarai Allen, Amauri Hardy, Pooh Jeter, and Malik Pope round out the list of veterans who will mentor the Ignite's prospects.

"We have a special group of veterans who have been super helpful and encouraging," Ignite head coach Jason Hart said in a statement.
